<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if the inner loop \\p Lp is uniform with regard to the outer loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// \\p OuterLp (i.e., if the outer loop is vectorized, all the vector lanes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// executing the inner loop will execute the same iterations). This check is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// very constrained for now but it will be relaxed in the future. \\p Lp is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// considered uniform if it meets all the following conditions:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   1) it has a canonical IV (starting from 0 and with stride 1),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   2) its latch terminator is a conditional branch and,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   3) its latch condition is a compare instruction whose operands are the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      canonical IV and an OuterLp invariant.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This check doesn&#39;t take into account the uniformity of other conditions not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// related to the loop latch because they don&#39;t affect the loop uniformity.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// NOTE: We decided to keep all these checks and its associated documentation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// together so that we can easily have a picture of the current supported loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// nests. However, some of the current checks don&#39;t depend on \\p OuterLp and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// would be redundantly executed for each \\p Lp if we invoked this function for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// different candidate outer loops. This is not the case for now because we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// don&#39;t currently have the infrastructure to evaluate multiple candidate outer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loops and \\p OuterLp will be a fixed parameter while we only support explicit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// outer loop vectorization. It&#39;s also very likely that these checks go away</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// before introducing the aforementioned infrastructure. However, if this is not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the case, we should move the \\p OuterLp independent checks to a separate</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function that is only executed once for each \\p Lp.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3eb7a9b091032d4d053727b7a578a97e"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3eb7a9b091032d4d053727b7a578a97e">isUniformLoop</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;Lp, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;OuterLp) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Lp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a1230fd674d2609b96527fe65eaf40b1b">getLoopLatch</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Expected loop with a single latch.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If Lp is the outer loop, it&#39;s uniform by definition.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Lp == OuterLp)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(OuterLp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a04337b572d34ea413c35dbac5d75530b">contains</a>(Lp) &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;OuterLp must contain Lp.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a78823051d1dad34b9b3d8120112e674d">IV</a> = Lp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop/#ae731e6e33c2f2a9a6ebd1d51886ce534">getCanonicalInductionVariable</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a78823051d1dad34b9b3d8120112e674d">IV</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;LV: Canonical IV not found.\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;Latch = Lp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a1230fd674d2609b96527fe65eaf40b1b">getLoopLatch</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;LatchBr = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;BranchInst&gt;</a>(Latch-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#aef9e9fcf4c5dfce90276ca16d91b8e46">getTerminator</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!LatchBr || LatchBr-&gt;isUnconditional()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A rewriter to build the SCEVs for each of the VF lanes in the expected</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><Highlight kind="comment">/// vectorized loop, which can then be compared to detect their uniformity. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is done by replacing the AddRec SCEVs of the original scalar loop (TheLoop)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="comment">/// with new AddRecs where the step is multiplied by StepMultiplier and Offset &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Step is added. Also checks if all sub-expressions are analyzable w.r.t.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><Highlight kind="comment">/// uniformity.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/anonymous-namespace-loopvectorizationlegality-cpp-/scevaddrecforuniformityrewriter"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/anonymous-namespace-loopvectorizationlegality-cpp-/scevaddrecforuniformityrewriter/#a1c8be59937395cb0e56939958d38a5b7">SCEVAddRecForUniformityRewriter</a></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Checks if a function is scalarizable according to the TLI, in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the sense that it should be vectorized and then expanded in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="comment">/// multiple scalar calls. This is represented in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TLI via mappings that do not specify a vector name, as in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="comment">/// following example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="comment">///    const VecDesc VecIntrinsics&#91;&#93; = &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#123;&quot;llvm.phx.abs.i32&quot;, &quot;&quot;, 4&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#125;;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae641260d79a9242ccf378d9a7949fdc3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae641260d79a9242ccf378d9a7949fdc3">isTLIScalarize</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &amp;TLI, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">CallInst</a> &amp;CI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> ScalarName = CI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a2b1ae7cf1bafdd43d1fee4c6ad0a2913">getCalledFunction</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#adb5c319f5905c1d3ca9eb5df546388c5">getName</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check that all known VFs are not associated to a vector</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function, i.e. the vector name is emty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns true if the call return type &#96;Ty&#96; can be widened by the loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
